oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Eddy Arnold interview - Michael Storey - Folk Voice
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Eddy Arnold (performer), conducted by Michael Storey for British radio program Folk Voice.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Michael Storey introduces Eddy Arnold to Folk Voice -- Eddy Arnold talks about how he got his start in his music career -- Arnold talks about his personal favorite songs -- Arnold talks about bridging the gap between pop music and country music -- Arnold talks about not being against any genre of music, and liking all fields of music -- Arnold talks about his recent recordings and how his style has changed throughout his career -- Arnold talks about his favorite singers being Cash, Marty Robbins, Patsy Cline -- Arnold says he wants to come to Britain sometime to perform and spend time -- Arnold talks about when he got his first big break in the music industry -- Arnold talks about his two cattle farms -- [Unidentified] thanks Eddy and concludes the interview -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Michael Storey)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Arnold, Eddy, 1918-2008;
